page.title: 01Bromesberrow and Eastnor.
page.content: The area is to be found at the southern end of the Malvern Hills. It comprises mainly of two large estates, Eastnor of 3000 acres and Bromesberrow of 1200 acres. The area is mainly arable, grassland and rough pasture farmland with areas of maintained woodland scattered throughout. There is also some common land and parkland. The landscape comprises of gently rolling hillsides and rugged escarpments. The population is sparsely scattered in small hamlets and isolated houses and farms. Narrow lanes and tracks traverse the area. There are very few amenities and some mode of personal transport is essential.
